title: Beijing Crematorium's Death Surge Points to Rising Covid Toll
description: One of the Chinese capital’s designated crematoria for Covid-19 patients has been flooded with dead bodies in the wake of the country’s loosening of pandemic restrictions.

title: EU Seeks to Unblock Russian Fertilizers Transit
description: The European Union implemented a new sanctions package on Russia that officials hope will significantly relieve food-security problems facing developing and poor countries.

title: Iran Protests Create Lasting Challenge to Government, Security Officials Say
China's Leaders Pledge to Focus on Economic Growth in 2023
description: President Xi Jinping and other leaders, at an annual meeting, vowed to focus on reviving growth momentum next year, after abandoning strict pandemic controls.

title: China Shows New Pragmatism on Economy
description: Easing Covid protocols and promoting property reflect a new growth push under President Xi Jinping.

title: The Chechen Warlord Who Does Putin's Dirty Work
description: Ramzan Kadyrov, once an anti-Russian rebel, now gets billions from Moscow and plays a key role in the battle for Ukraine.

title: Giant Aquarium in Berlin Holding 1,500 Fish Bursts
description: A giant cylindrical aquarium that had become a landmark in the years since the fall of the Berlin Wall burst, raining one million liters of water and 1,500 exotic fish on a busy crossing.

title: Russia Targets Infrastructure Across Ukraine in Latest Barrage
description: Russia fired a barrage of missiles targeting energy infrastructure in Kyiv and other Ukrainian cities, part of a campaign to wear down its adversary while rebuilding for an expected renewed ground offensive.

title: North Korea Tests New Rocket Engine to Enable Long-Range Missile Strikes
description: Leader Kim Jong Un oversaw a test of an engine using solid fuel, which can allow missiles to be deployed more quickly and covertly.

title: Japan to Build a More Powerful Military, Citing China as Its No. 1 Menace
description: Japan called China its biggest security challenge and said it would sharply raise military spending including for missiles that can hit other countries.
